headline.seo: Google Casts a Big Shadow on Smaller Web Sites

headline.print_headline: Living, and Dying, in Google’s World

docs.abstract: Google's secret and frequently fluctuating search algorithm, for Web sites that depend on their ranking in search results, can evoke a complex blend of admiration and fear; it has 67 percent of United States search market and collects 75 percent of search ad revenue; Federal Trade Commission recommends preparing antitrust suit against Google over whether it uses its search engine to favor its offerings like Google Shopping over rivals.

docs.lead_paragraph: “In the first six months of this year, governments around the world made 20,938 requests to Google to provide information on 34,614 accounts, the company said,” Natasha Singer reports on the Bits blog. “In the same period in 2011, governments made 15,744 requests on 25,342 accounts, according to company data.”

headline.main: European Countries Seek More Taxes From U.S. Multinational Companies
headline.print_headline: European Countries Seek More Taxes From U.S. Multinational Companies

docs.abstract: European governments, seeking to close budget holes, are cracking down on American companies like Google and Amazon.com that pay little or no taxes there despite generating billions of dollars in revenue; such companies typically use complex accounting strategies that exploit national differences across Europe in corporate tax rates.
